p: Compounds 1 and 2 both had strong inhibitory activities on α-glycosidase, especially 2. Therefore, it was necessary to investigate the inhibition types and calculate the inhibition kinetics constants ( K i). Results of enzyme kinetics study were performed by using Dixon plots and Lineweaver-Burk plots. The results were displayed in Table 3 and Figure 2. In Figure 2, K m values of α-glucosidase in the existence of 1 did not change but V max values of α-glucosidase with the compounds progressively reduced, pointing that 1 was in a noncompetitive inhibitor manner with the K i value of 732.95 ± 0.22 nM. In addition, 2 restrained α-glucosidase in competitive manner as the V max maintained constant and K m improved. Meanwhile, K i value of this compound was calculated as 98.37 ± 0.31 nM. Competitive inhibitors were known to compete with substrates for the active sites of enzymes, whereas noncompetitive inhibitors primarily bind to allosteric sites of enzyme-substrate complexes [ 40].
